snippet: A new study disputes findings that obesity among young children has declined, but because both sets of research used different time frames, both may be right.
abstract: Study published in Journal of the American Medical Association presents data that conflicts with research showing that childhood obesity among young children has fallen since 2004; differing results have prompted scientists to debate whether obesity is declining or not.
lead_paragraph: A new study disputes findings that obesity among young children has declined, but because both sets of research used different time frames, both may be right.

headline.main: Obesity Studies Tell Two Stories, Both Right
headline.print_headline: Obesity Studies Tell Two Stories, Both Right

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
